meanings.definition: A raised bank or wall built to carry a roadway or hold back water.
meanings.sent1: The workers built an embankment to support the new road.
meanings.sent2: The river overflowed, but the embankment prevented flooding in the town.
meanings.sent3: The ducks enjoyed waddling along the embankment by the pond.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an embankment, strong and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the embankment painted the sky in shades of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: The action of embanking an area.
meanings.sent1: The embankment of the river was necessary to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent2: The embankment of the field helped with irrigation.
meanings.sent3: The embankment of the garden was a laborious task, but worth it.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like an embankment, protecting those around him.
meanings.sent5: The embankment of the hillside was a challenging project, but the view from the top was rewarding.
